means: （使）闪耀( flare的过去式和过去分词 )
（使）（衣裙、酒杯等）呈喇叭形展开

sentence.Network_en: He stuck out his tongue and flared his nostrils.
sentence.Network_cn: 他伸出舌头，鼻翼扇动着。

sentence.Network_en: In the 1970s they all had flared trousers.
sentence.Network_cn: 20世纪70年代的时候他们人人都有喇叭裤。

sentence.Network_en: The match flared and went out.
sentence.Network_cn: 火柴闪亮了一下就熄了。

entry.tran: (裙子或裤子)喇叭形的，阔腿的
entry.def: Flared skirts or trousers are wider at the bottom or at the end of the legs than at the top.

example.ex: In the 1970s they all had flared trousers.
example.tran: 20世纪70年代的时候他们人人都有喇叭裤。

means.word_mean: 1. having a gradual increase in width;
